info:identity.info:name: redundant
info:identity.info:description:
Sample applications demonstrating redundant stream processing.
The concepts of redundant processing in IBM Streams are covered in two Streamsdev articles *Application High Availability in IBM® InfoSphere® Streams with Active Replicas* : * [https://developer.ibm.com/streamsdev/docs/application-high-availability-ibm-infosphere-streams-active-replicas-part-1/ | Part 1 - Active Replicas] * [https://developer.ibm.com/streamsdev/docs/application-high-availability-ibm-infosphere-streams-active-replicas-part-2/ | Part 2 - Redundant De-Duplication with Leadership ] The articles were written against Streams 3.2 and an experiment control toolkit. For Streams 4.0 and later the `JobControlPlane` operator and the `com.ibm.streamsx.plumbing` toolkit contain the evolutions of the older control toolkit.
